sen.j: 西寺（さいじ）は、平安時代、現在の京都市南区 (京都市)唐橋にあったとされる寺で、796年桓武天皇の勅願により平安京内で最初に建造が許された2つの官寺の一つ。
sen.e: Sai-ji Temple is believed to have stood in present-day Karahashi, Minami Ward, Kyoto City, and was one of the two first governmental temples permitted to be constructed within the city of Heian-kyo by the order of Emperor Konmu.

sen.j: 当時は、羅城門を入ってすぐ、朱雀大路を挟んで東側に東寺があり、西側に西寺があった。

sen.j: 西寺は東寺とほぼ同規模の大きさの寺院だとされ、僧綱所などが置かれたとされる。
sen.e: Sai-ji Temple and To-ji Temple are thought to have been of approximately the same size and believed to have contained a Sogosho (office of the Buddhist ecclesiastical authority).

sen.j: 西寺の僧であった守敏の衰退とともに寺も廃れていったとされる。
sen.e: The temple is thought to have gone into decline as Shubin, the priest of Sai-ji Temple, grew weaker.

sen.e: After almost all of the buildings were destroyed by fire in the year 990, another fire struck in 1233 and the temple fell into ruin.

sen.j: 1959年からの発掘調査により、金堂・廻廊・僧坊・食堂院・南大門等の遺構が確認され、当初の未指定部分が1966年に追加指定された。
sen.e: Excavations that started in 1959 uncovered the remains of structures including the main hall, corridors, the priests' living quarters, the dining hall and Nandaimon Gate, with those that were not included in the original historic site designation being added in 1966.
